subject: Re: [junit] Putting all your JUnit tests in separate Eclipse project?
msgSnippet: While I recognize the potential for the issues you raise, I have never seen any of them in any of my JUnit experience (seven, maybe eight years now). I use the
messageBody:
While I recognize the potential for the issues you raise, I have never seen
any of them in any of my JUnit experience (seven, maybe eight years now). I
use the parallel directory structure approach and never had a problem with
that either.

The biggest problem is getting programmers to write tests, followed by
getting them to write good tests that actually test all aspects of the code.

My 1/50th of a US Federal Reserve note.

Simon
(One of the JUnit mailing list moderators)



On Thu, Feb 11, 2010 at 3:28 PM, willmcqueen <willmcqueen@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> Has anyone out there tried moving all of your JUnit test cases into a
> separate Eclipse project, rather than keeping them within your main project?
>
> <snip>
